title: Capacity-Building Course for Designing High-Quality Online Learning Materials

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Knowledge of Online Learning Platforms and Fundamental Social Studies Knowledge
context.additional_context: Social sciences job-linked training programs for office/administrative workers

learning_goals: Learners can design the basic structure of online learning materials according to the design and development phases of the ADDIE model

Within a 2–4 week period, learners will produce one multimodal learning material combining text, images, and videos, incorporating at least three personalized elements (e.g., customized examples, interactive quizzes) tailored to learner profiles (age, interests), and submit a final product meeting over 80% of peer review and instructor feedback criteria (clarity, creativity, effectiveness).

Within four weeks, learners will develop one educational simulation content applying three interaction design principles for supporting learner autonomy (e.g., providing choice, feedback systems, self-assessment tools), achieving over 4 points (on a 5-point scale) in at least four of the five expert evaluation criteria (functionality, user experience, educational effectiveness).
Learners execute procedures to continuously improve the quality of online learning materials using formative assessment tools
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
